Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Upekha
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and the staff very helpful: every time I came in they offered me a cup of tea! The bathroom was basic, no shower recess, but clean. Excellent location in Sultanahmet, close to tram stop, Sirkeci (very convenient to travel to airport by tram (if you don't have too much luggage). Wi-fi in room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and good staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Riitta Y
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip in Istanbul but not the last,it was so nice many different way.Two weeks with low budget and I'm so HAPPY that I find so nice Hotel than Hotel Emin,cosy and comfortable,lucky me!! Nice, warm and clean room,comfotable bed,good Turkish breakfast. The staff are super,all off them,from the reception to the kitchen.They made you feel so cosy. Good food, fantastic "pillow bar" as I call it,where you can relax and enjoy good Turkish tea or other beverage and also eat some nice food. The location of the hotel is great,close to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, The Spice Market, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace.Tram stops are also very close,just few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nina G
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Really nice hotel, clean room, good food and very helpful and nice staff. Located in the centre, was possible to get by walk to every sighteseeng that was worth to see. If we ever go back to Istanbul again, we won't choose any other hotel for sure :-)

Reviews.Title: “City visit - Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Adrijana H
Reviews.Content: Good value for money - hotel is situated in the very center of main attractions and all of them can be easily accessed from the Hotel. Public transports is at your door step and many good restaurants as well. Hotel is clean and staff is friendly. Try Restaurant special meal - worth every single EUR! If you don't want to spend too much money on hotel and you need it only for overnights - good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Theapigen
Reviews.Content: Emin hotel is a cute, inexpensive hotel in a phenomenal location. The rooms, though not huge, are functional and charming, and the bathrooms are nice and quite big. The staff are wonderful, both in the restaurant and in the reception, and always made us feel more than welcome. The food in the restaurant was also very good and inexpensive. The receptionist (Mehmet) spoke very good English and was very helpful whatever our needs. All in all, a great experience, and I'll be staying here again next time I come back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “lot of value for money and good service :D”
Reviews.Author: gina s
Reviews.Content: we were not looking to spend a lot of money on hotel and this hotel has great value for money :) although they were doing some renovation they went out of their way to make our stay as good as possible. and we got a room with newly renovated bathroom, very nice... otherwise the room was clean with comfortable bed, and breakfast normal for turkish standard. also there were a very nice reastaurant at the hotel with good food. a pluss for the hotel is definitely that the staff speak very good and fluently english the hotel is very central to a lot of attractions in walking distance and very easy to use public tranportation when you want to get around in the city. i think when we go back next year we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: aeronaut
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind that the Emin Hotel is a 2 star turkish hotel- cheerful, kitch and probably a bit dangerous. If you book this hotel you better bring your good sense of humour. Emin Hotel is a family run facility situated in Sirkeci- probably the best area for first timers to Istanbul. The hotel has 4 floors and no elevator (which is quite common)- staff do offer to carry your luggage. Reception area is tiny and mostly crowded by people who really doesnt have a purpose at the hotel- thats just Turkish socializing- but it does not leave much place for the guests. One day the reception was unmanned all day- you had to help yourself to your key- and also a possability for others to do so. One day my key was missing when I came back- some repairs were going on on my floor- or so i was told- when going to 3rd floor there were no one there- but keys were in the hall way- no one looked after them. I suggest you bring a lock on your suitcase and put any valuables in it- you can not be sure that anyone looks after your key. reception guy is so busy "caring" for his extra service for the female guests on the net that he does not have a clue of what is going on. Rooms are VERY tiny- you need to be fit to be able to move around and if you suffer from claustrophobia this is not a place for you. There is not much storage room- only a small cuppboard you can reach by crawling over the bed. Bed is quite comfy and I did not have any problems with bedbugs. There is a tv- but reception is so bad that you are not really able to watch it. Aircon did work- you have to crawl on the bed to put it on, unfortunately you will also see the filters which have probably never been cleaned- yikes! The room decor is somewhat 70Â´ies kitch- which can be quite fun. Carpet is incredible dirty and sticky- bring slippers. Probably not a good idea to look under the bed. Walls are paperthin- bring earplugs. Bathroom is ok in size- plumming bad, waterpressure is somewhat on the weak side- you will some days be able to squeeze some hot water from the pipes. My biggest worry are the electric installations- all hanging out from the wall- one day I had no electricity and they did the repair themselves- resulting in a small firework when trying to switch on the light. Bathroom lamp hanging out from wall- combined with water- i would rate this as hazardous. I did have my towels and linnen changed every second day- which was fine. Wifi worked fine during my stay. The hotel has a restaurant in Turkish style. Breakfast is typical turkish: olives, egg, cucumber, tomatoe, cheese, honey, butter and marmelade. Tea/coffee and white bread- tasty indeed. Waiter was smoking during service and picked his nose and did not wash his hands. Toilets are discusting and water for wiping floors, pitchblack. Allthough looking very charming from outside I did not have a wish to have any more meals at this place. If you are joining in on excursions (pick ups 730-800) you will not be able to get your bkfast as this hotel only starts its service at 8:30- I did try to arrange early service on my days of excursions- reception guy said yes- morning guy said no and continued to sleep on his couch in the reception....You can get a nice bkfastbuffet just opposite at The Flower palace Hotel at a cost of 20TRY. Ohh one thing- even that the hotel has sightseeing brochures available- do NOT expect them to have any knowledge about the treasures of the city- visit a touroperator on the corner who can help you. You can easily walk to most things from the Emin- or use the tram line. Prebook your airport transfers (plenty on offer on the net) and avoid taxis at all costs- if you do so be prepared to pay quite a lot, and never give them a 50TRY note- it will be changed into a 5TRY note a common thing in Turkey. Never be afraid to go to the police if you encounter the crooks- the tourist police station is just next to the Aya Sofya- yellow wooden building. remember to write down the car number. Having been to istanbul many times- and having a quite good sense of humour and positive outlook on life, I would never choose this hotel again

HotelInfo.Name: Emin Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Saffettin Pasa Sok. No:18 | Sirkeci, Istanbul 34110, Turkey
